intro: Vincetoxicum dorgelonis, commonly known as the Dorgelon's agrimony, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and vines. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and clusters of small, white to yellowish flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant is not widely cultivated but is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and habitat preferences.
